channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024030953
item.description:
Report X-2024030953

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-16
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While dock walking package was found in a red tote under roller line. Admin picked up package to inspect, found a wet corner and brought it to QA. DescribePack: Once package was opened it was found that one of the bottles had no lid on it and there was substantial amount of product that had leaked out of the bottle into the inside of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept up right in a tote before inspection and after inspection lid was put back on and tightened.

item.title: Report X-2024030956
item.description:
Report X-2024030956

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-17
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found wet and QA was called. We cleaned up the spilled product with spill pads and secured the package and soiled clean up equipment in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote

item.title: Report X-2024031009
item.description:
Report X-2024031009

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO INNER BOXES MARKED 9MM 147GR RN LOW RECOIL (900 FPS) 500 ROUNDS. THESE INNER BOXES CONTAINED LOOSE AMMUNITION WITH SOME POKING THROUGH ONE SIDE OF THE INNER BOXES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE AMMUNITION WAS BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM ATL TO SDF PRIOR TO THE DISCOVERY.

item.title: Report X-2024030624
item.description:
Report X-2024030624

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030624 RESPONDER GOT A CALL FOR A LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD. WHEN RESPONDER ARRIVED SAW THAT IT WAS A HAZMAT AND USED DECISION TREE AND PUT THE PROPER PPE ON. ONCE RESPONDER WAS DONE CLEANING THE SPILL UP, TOOK IT BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. 2. X-2024030625 RESPONDER GOT A CALL FOR A LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD. WHEN RESPONDER ARRIVED SAW THAT IT WAS A HAZMAT AND USED DECISION TREE OUT AND PUT PROPER PPE ON. WHEN RESPONDER WAS DONE CLEANING UP THE SPILL, TOOK THE LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP.
